channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Influencer, White House welfare fraud claims are distorted, but the system has risks
item.description: Federal officials are targeting Democratic-led states over alleged safety-net fraud. Critics worry a drumbeat of unfounded accusations could undermine public trust.
item.content:encoded:
Federal officials are targeting Democratic-led states over alleged safety-net fraud. Critics worry a drumbeat of unfounded accusations could undermine public trust.

(Image credit: Giovanna Dell'Orto)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: Two parents reflect on giving back after Camp Mystic tragedy
item.description: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.content:encoded: After deadly floods hit Central Texas in July, families whose daughters died at a sleepaway camp are keeping their legacies alive. We speak to two parents who helped create the Heaven's 27 Foundation.
item.dc:creator: Ava Berger

item.title: NPR/Ipsos poll shows Americans doubt U.S. role as global moral leader
item.description: A new NPR/Ipsos poll released Friday finds Americans still want the U.S. to be a moral leader in the world — but far fewer think it actually is.
item.content:encoded: A new NPR/Ipsos poll released Friday finds Americans still want the U.S. to be a moral leader in the world — but far fewer think it actually is.
item.dc:creator: Jackie Northam

item.title: State officials say they'll do their own probes of shootings by federal officers
item.description: We get an overview of the two newsworthy shootings that happened involving an ICE agent in Minneapolis and a border patrol officer Portland this week.
item.content:encoded: We get an overview of the two newsworthy shootings that happened involving an ICE agent in Minneapolis and a border patrol officer Portland this week.
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Six months later, the Texas Hill Country is still living with the flood
item.description: Six months ago catastrophic floods ravaged the Texas's Hill Country, leaving more than 130 people dead and billions of dollars in damages. Since, families of some of the victims are suing vacation camps and state legislation passed disaster prevention laws. We provide an update on where things stand.
item.content:encoded: Six months ago catastrophic floods ravaged the Texas's Hill Country, leaving more than 130 people dead and billions of dollars in damages. Since, families of some of the victims are suing vacation camps and state legislation passed disaster prevention laws. We provide an update on where things stand.
item.dc:creator: Lucio Vasquez

item.title: U.S. Figure Skating Championships will determine who's going to the Olympics
item.description: This week's competition in St. Louis will skaters tickets to the Milan-Cortina games in February
item.content:encoded:
This week's competition in St. Louis will skaters tickets to the Milan-Cortina games in February

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: Lillian Karabaic

item.title: Frictions over investigations emerge after ICE agent fatally shoots Minneapolis woman
item.description: Minnesota officials launch their own effort to collect evidence in the killing of Renee Good by an ICE agent. The move comes after shootings involving federal agents in Minneapolis and Portland, Ore.
item.content:encoded:
Minnesota officials launch their own effort to collect evidence in the killing of Renee Good by an ICE agent. The move comes after shootings involving federal agents in Minneapolis and Portland, Ore.

(Image credit: Kerem Yucel/MPR)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: National Park Service will void passes with stickers over Trump's face
item.description: The use of an image of Trump on the 2026 pass — rather than the usual picture of nature — has sparked a backlash, sticker protests, and a lawsuit from a conservation group.
item.content:encoded:
The use of an image of Trump on the 2026 pass — rather than the usual picture of nature — has sparked a backlash, sticker protests, and a lawsuit from a conservation group.

(Image credit: Department of Interior)
item.dc:creator: Windsor Johnston

item.title: Poll: Fewer Americans see U.S. as moral leader. And, FBI takes over ICE shooting case
item.description: Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be, according to an NPR/Ipsos poll. And, the FBI is taking over the investigation into the fatal Minnesota ICE shooting.
item.content:encoded:
Many Americans say the U.S. is not a moral leader but want it to be, according to an NPR/Ipsos poll. And, the FBI is taking over the investigation into the fatal Minnesota ICE shooting.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Somber Minneapolis demonstrators protest fatal shooting of woman by ICE officer
item.description: Hundreds of somber demonstrators took to Minneapolis' frozen streets to protest the fatal shooting of a woman by an ICE agent.
item.content:encoded: Hundreds of somber demonstrators took to Minneapolis' frozen streets to protest the fatal shooting of a woman by an ICE agent.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson
